Mayor and Council
=================

Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.
[Most Recent Agenda](https://www.cityoflg.com/departments/documents.php)
|
[View All Agendas and Minutes](https://www.cityoflg.com/departments/documents.php)
La Grange is a Home Rule Charter City with an elected Mayor and City Council. The City Manager is hired by the City Council. The Mayor is elected at large and serves a two year term. The Council consists of 8 members each serving 2 year terms. The City consists of
[4 Wards](https://www.cityoflg.com/LG_wards_2022.pdf)
with 2 Council members representing each Ward. One council member is elected each year from each ward. The fiscal year runs from October 1st through September 30th.
[City Council Ward Map 2022](https://www.cityoflg.com/LG_wards_2022.pdf)

La Grange City Council is the governing body of the City of La Grange. Regular meetings are held on the second and fourth Monday at 6 p.m. in the City Council Chambers, 155 E. Colorado. The public may address the City Council briefly during the Citizen Participation portion of a regular meeting. The Citizen Participation portion is held at the beginning of the City Council meeting. Citizens are asked to arrive at the meeting prior to its start and to fill out a Speaker Request Form to be turned in to the City Secretary prior to the meeting start. Citizens are allowed to speak for three (3) minutes during the Citizen Participation portion.

The City of La Grange conducts an officers’ election on the first Saturday in May of each year. A mayor and eight council members are elected for staggered two-year terms. Elections are held in the City Council Chambers, 155 E. Colorado.
